question.title: What is the typical radiographic finding in the wrist of a patient with calcification of the triangular ligament of the carpus?
question.description: A radiographic finding in the wrist of a patient with calcification of the triangular ligament of the carpus

option_a.title: Calcification of the extensor retinaculum
option_a.description: A radiographic finding in the wrist, but not typically associated with calcification of the triangular ligament of the carpus

option_b.title: Calcification of the triangular ligament of the carpus

option_c.title: Osteophytes in the scaphoid bone
option_c.description: A common radiographic finding in rheumatoid arthritis, but not typically associated with calcification of the triangular ligament of the carpus

option_d.title: Tendinosis of the flexor carpi ulnaris tendon
option_d.description: A condition that can cause wrist pain, but is not typically associated with calcification of the triangular ligament of the carpus

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The letter of the correct option
